intro: Hieracium querceticola, commonly known as the oak-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in woodlands and meadows, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium querceticola is known for its ability to thrive in shaded environments, making it a common sight in forested areas.
